p: The antiviral effect of an ethanol extract of the roots and rhizomes of Rheum palmatum (Polygonaceae family) against coxsackievirus B 3 (CVB 3) was evaluated in tissue culture cells and a mouse model. The ethanol extract from R. palmatum showed significant inhibitory activity against CVB 3-infected HEP-2 cells when added after infection. The serum of mice still contained the pharmaceutical compound 24 h after intraperitoneal injection, and the extract exhibited an antiviral effect on CVB 3-infected cells. The ethanol extract-treated mice showed alleviated clinical signs, a better survival rate, and a higher maximum tolerated dose along with decreased viral titers compared with the virus control group. These results indicated that the ethanol extract from R. palmatum had anti-CVB 3 activity in vitro and in vivo 82 ( Table 1).
